revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Joe Robinson | image = Joe ontheair.jpg | caption = Joe on the air | birthname = Joseph Mitchell Robinson | birth_date = December 2, 1968 | birth_place = Silver Spring, Maryland | parents = Ralph, Kerry | children = Joseph, Jr
James | known_for = | occupation = [[Radio personality]], [[Comedian]] }} [[Image:JOE ROBINSON-WIKI2.JPG|thumb|Joe Robinson in 1989.]] '''Joe Robinson''' (born December 2, 1968) is an American [[comedian]] and former radio host on "Irresponsible Radio with Theo & Joe"98 Rock WIYY Baltimore archived jock pages that was broadcast 7PM-Midnight on [[WIYY]], 98Rock (97.9 FM) in [[Baltimore, Maryland]], from September 2007-July 2008. A veteran of Baltimore/[[Washington, D.C.|DC]] comedy, Joe has opened for [[DC Benny]], [[Tom Rhodes]] and [[Dave Attell]]. After placing in both the 2006 "DC Improv Showcase" and "Funniest Person in Baltimore" competitions, Joe most recently was the winner of the Arlington Drafthouse Comedy Competition. He got his start in radio on XM Comedy and as a regular on [[WIYY|98 Rock's]] [[Mickey and Amelia|Mickey, Amelia & Spiegel Morning Show]]. In the 2007-2008 [[NFL]] season he was also the co-host on 98 Rock's "Ravens' [http://www.98online.com/show/last-call-with-joe-robinson/ Last Call]" post-game show. He returned as the host of that show in 2015. Joe can currently be heard at a regular guest and substitute host on the [[Justin, Scott, and Speigel|98 Rock Morning show]]. In 2011 he worked briefly on 1090 AM WBAL as a regular panelist on the station's "Week in Review" program as well as one of the rotating hosts of "1090 at Night". He also co-hosts a comedy-oriented show (which more closely resembles his 98 Rock Show) live on the internet every Monday at 7:30pm with comedian [http://robmaher.com/ Rob Maher]. In 2016, Joe received national attention when he was critical of [[Tom_Arnold_(actor)]] following a [[Baltimore]] comedy show, where Robinson was his opening act. Arnold "returned fire" on Twitter after hearing the discussion on the [[Justin,_Scott,_and_Spiegel]] Morning Show, where Robinson detailed the actor's behavior throughout the evening. ==References== {{Reflist}} *[http://theinterrobang.com/tom-arnold-fights-opener-baltimore Tom Arnold Goes on 55 Tweet Rant] *[http://www.baltimoresun.com/features/baltimore-insider-blog/bal-baltimore-comedian-joe-robinson-at-odds-with-comedian-tom-arnold-htmlstory.html Baltimore Comedian at odds with Tom Arnold] *[http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=459981 FMQB] *[http://cclamp.radioandrecords.com/RRWebSite/Search.aspx?search=Joe%20Robinson Radio&Record] *[http://www.98online.com/show/last-call-with-joe-robinson Ravens Last Call Show] *[http://www.baltimoresun.com/entertainment/music/bal-artslife-comedy,0,7773999.story?page=3&coll=bal-music-utility/ Baltimore Sun - "Just for Laughs"] *[http://www.baltimoresun.com/entertainment/music/bal-artslife-comedy-quotes,0,5615960.story?coll=bal-music-utility&?track=sto-relcon/ Baltimore Sun - "In their words - What the comics have to say"] *[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/07/20/AR2006072001694_4.html?sub=AR/ Washington Post - "on Stage"] *[http://upcoming.yahoo.com/event/235733/DC/Washington-DC/HBO39s-quotLucky-21quot-Comedy-Festival-Contest/DC-Improv-Comedy-Club/ HBO's Lucky 21 Comedy Festival] *{{YouTube|uoAxcUW1o2U|Arlington Drafthouse Comedy Competition}} *[http://www.xmfan.com/guide.php?q=Joe+Robinson&mode=artist&sort=Channel XM Comedy] *[http://www.robandjoe.com/ The Rob and Joe Show] ==External links== * [http://www.joerobinsoncomedy.com/ Official site] ==External links== * [http://www.robandjoeshow.com/ Official site] {{DEFAULTSORT:Robinson, Joe}} [[Category:American comedians]] [[Category:American radio personalities]] [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Living people]] {{US-radio-bio-stub}}
